question: An expenses is said to be revenue in nature if it
option_a: adds or contributes to the operating income of the business
option_b: necessitates the introduction of additional capital
option_c: reduces the capital of the business
option_d: adds to or improves the value of fixed assets
solution: This is a very correct option to the question asked. Preliminary or preoperative expenses is a good example. They are expended and have a very great contribution to the income generated.

question: An entry in a subsidiary book which does not form part of the double entry system is a
solution: A memorandum entry is not a complete journal entry because it does not contain debit and credit amounts e.g. stock split which does not affect the common stock account.

question: Determine wage expenses from the given information, wages outstanding at the beginning, wages paid during the period 15000 and wages outstanding of the period 2,000
Which method of pricing can be used satisfactorily in either rising or falling price situation?
solution: An average method which accommodate all the prices and then divide (inform of mean) is well acceptable in either of the two situation.

question:
Use the information below to answer this question.

\(\begin{array}{c|c} \text{Stock} & 11,250 \\ \hline \text{Debtors} & 18,750 \\ \hline \text{Creditors} & 3,750 \\ \hline \text{Bank} & 4,000 \\ \hline \text{Net profit} & 7,500 \\ \hline \text{Net} & 60,000 \\ \end{array}\)

Calculate the acid test ratio
solution:
given that acid test ratio is:

\(\frac {\text{Current assets – stock}}{\text{Current liabilities}}\)

Current assets:\(\frac {\text{stock + Debtors + bank – stock}}{\text{Current liabilities}}\)

\(\frac{11250 + 18750 + 4000 – 11250}{3750}\)

= 34000 – 11250 = 22750 = 6:1:1

question:
Use the following information to answer this question.

Club building 400,000

Subscription prepaid 3,000

Sport kits 150,000

Bar creditors 85,000

Subscription owing 32,000

What is the club’s accumulated fund?
solution:
Total asset less current liabilities

400000 + 205000 + 150,000 + 32000– 85000– 3000 = 699000

question: What will be the number of shares to be issued to a subscriber who applied for 50,000 units.
solution:
Allotment = 500,000 = 0.4 or 40%

∴ Each subscriber would get 40% shares of what they applied for.

∴ 50,000 x 0.4 = 20,000 units

option_a: expenses which can be identified with an allocated to cost centers
option_b: aggregate direct material cost, direct labour cost and variable direct expenses
option_c: the cost taken into account in the production process whether direct or indirect
option_d: the cost of commodities supply to an undertaking

question: The accounting concept that allows the cost of kitchen cutlery to be expensed, though it can be used for more than one year is
solution: Materiality states that only items of material values are recorded e.g. the cost of a stapler should not be capitalized but expensed just as kitchen cutlery.

question:

Timo and Chris are computer engineers who went into partnership as Teachi and Co. Timo brought cash ofN12,000 furniture worth of N18,000 and vehicle worth of 70,000. Chris equally brought in cash of 10,000 his building valued at 105,000 and personal computers worth N35,000.

What is the profit sharing ratio if it’s based on capital contribution by Teechi and Co?

Using LIFO method of stock valuation, analyze the issue quantities and their prices
option_c: 200 units at N1.50 and 500 units at N1.00
option_d: 350 units at N1.50 and 350 units at N1.00

question: Which of the following is a debit entry in debtors control account?
Which of the following is not a proper form of the accounting equation
option_a: fixed assets + current assets  - liabilities = capital
option_b: fixed assests + current assests + liabilities = capital
option_c: fixed assets – liabilities + current assets = capital
option_d: fixed asset + current asset – capital = liabilities

question: The accounting convention that state that stock should be value that the lower of cost and net realized value is --------------- convention
What does liquidity ratio measure?
option_a: measures operating efficiency of a company
option_b: measures the ability of a company to meet its current obligations.
option_c: measures the value of investments of a company
option_d: measures the financial leverage of a company
solution: liquidity ratio attempt to measure the ability to meet up with current obligations e.g. current ratio which measures the current asset to current liabilities.

question: Derive the stock turnover period.(Average stock = 23,000. Cost of sales = 300,000 year = 365 days).
solution: Average stock / cost of sales x 365days.

question: The following accounting entries are made when bad debt is recovered
option_a: debit bad debts accounts and credit bad debt recovered account
option_b: debit debtors accounts and recovered account
option_c: debit bad debts recovered account and credit bad debts account
option_d: debit bad debts account and credit profit and loss account

question: One of the items listed below will not be found in a company’s memorandum and article of association. Which is it?

Sales ledger control account contains the total amount in respect of
solution: The sales ledger control account is also known as debtors control account and includes all entries of debtors as if only one existed.

question: The following account are prepared when goods are sent to branch except
The basis of accounting for public sector is
solution: This is the basis for recording in government accounting where revenue are recorded when cash is received.

.

question:
Use the information below to answer this question.

\(\begin{array}{c|c} \text{Raw materials jan.} & 5,000 \\ \hline \text{Raw materials dec.} & 5,800 \\ \hline \text{Purchase of raw materials} & 45,000 \\ \hline \text{Salary} & 61,000 \\ \hline \text{Factory lubricant} & 2,050 \\ \hline \text{plant depreciation} & 1,300 \\ \hline \text{Factory insurance} & 1,250 \\ \end{array}\)

The prime cost for the company is
solution:
The prime cost are direct cost,direct material cost, direct labour cost and direct expenses.

Therefore:

Raw materials (jan)5000

Add purchases 45,000

Less raw materials (dec) 5,800

Cost of raw materials consume 44,200

Prime cost 169,200

question: What is the ledger entry for sale of generator on credit to Patrick?
option_a: credit sales account and debit Patrick’s account
option_b: credit generator account and debit cash account
option_c: credit sales account and debit cash account
option_d: credit generator account and debit Patrick’s account
solution: Patrick is receiving and should be debited while generator account is giving

question: Sai Baba made sales of N10,000 having computed his gross profit % to sales to be 20. His opening stock was N250 and ending stock is N200. Calculate his purchases.
solution:
The gross profit percentage of sales would be

20% x N 10,000 = N 2000

If cost of sales + gross profit = N 10,000 = N 2000

:. N 8000 + N 2000 = N 10,000

If cost of goods available for sales less closing stock

= cost of sales

:. N8200 + N200 = N8000

Hence; cost of goods available for sale = opening stock + purchases

:. N8200 = N250 + A

= N 8200 – N 250

=N 7950

question:
Use the information below to answer this question.

Jejelaye Plc stock records for 2009 was given below:

Jan 1 received 100 units at N1.00

Jan 8 received 260 units at N1.05

Jan 20 issued 700units at .........

Feb 3 received 400 units at N1.15

What will be the issued price of 700 units, using simple average method
solution: simple average method usually add up all receipt prices ahead of the issued material divided by 2

question: Income and expenditure account is more detailed than receipts and payments account because it disclosed
solution: the income and expenditure account unlike the receipts and payments takes records of accruals and prepayment

question: Capital reserves includes the following except
solution: general reserves is not a form of capital reserves. It is considered as revenue reserves

question: Which of the following is not a feature of accounting information?
solution: accounting information and report must be accurate, complete and timely. Money spent to obtain an information is not as important as how useful are those information in taking decisions.

question: The accounting concepts which assumes that business will continue to be in existence into the foresee ablefure is
solution: This concept is the only one among the listed that assumes that the business will continue to operate for an indefinitely long period of time.

question: The purpose of a trading account is to ascertain
solution: The trading account is primarily prepared to ascertain gross profit or loss.
